alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 15 at 8:44PM CDT until July 19 at 8:20PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Alabama... Sucarnoochee River At Livingston affecting Sumter County. .The Sucarnoochee River at Livingston continues to slowly rise, and is now forecast to crest right at moderate flood stage. Another statement will be issued by Sunday morning, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sucarnoochee River At Livingston. * WHEN...Until Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Some secondary low-lying roads and a few yards begin to flood in southeast Livingston. At 25.0 feet, Some homes in southeast Livingston flood and a few evacuations are necessary. Considerable flooding of low-lying agricultural lands occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 24.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM CDT Saturday was 24.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
